p: To dislodge adhering sediment and starch, tools were shaken in an ultrasonic water bath for 5 to 10 minutes, and starch was then isolated using heavy liquid flotation with a solution of CsCl at a density of 1.8 g/cm 3. The recovered residue was mounted in 10% glycerine and 90% water on a slide and examined with both white and cross-polarized light at a magnification of 400×. Starch grains were counted, analyzed for morphological features, then recorded and compared with those from the modern reference collection.
